issue.title: Compilation is broken on default branch for Xenial/Wily

content.raw:
Yes, I meant the pull-request CI pipeline. I suggested it for the ignition jobs, since they are relatively fast, as compared to gazebo.

Also, the `ignition-transport` default branch (eventually `ign-transport2`) will be used by gazebo8, which we are currently not planning to support on trusty. So for `ignition-transport` at least, it makes more sense to test xenial than trusty.
content.html:
Yes, I meant the pull-request CI pipeline. I suggested it for the ignition jobs, since they are relatively fast, as compared to gazebo.

Also, the ignition-transport default branch (eventually ign-transport2) will be used by gazebo8, which we are currently not planning to support on trusty. So for ignition-transport at least, it makes more sense to test xenial than trusty.
